required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing the ADR With Air Insufflation, Water Immersion and Water Exchange During Two-endoscopist Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Trial Comparing the Adenoma Detection Rate With Air Insufflation, Water Immersion and Water Exchange During Two-endoscopist Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: Interval (missed) cancers and lower than expected mortality reduction of proximal colon cancers in the United States and elsewhere after screening colonoscopy drew attention to quality indicators. Missed adenomas which are more likely to be in the proximal colon may be contributing factors. An independent predictor of the risk of interval cancers is adenoma detection rate. In pilot observations, the investigators showed that water exchange enhanced adenoma detection in the right colon (cecum to hepatic flexure). This prospective, randomized controlled trial will compare water exchange with water immersion and traditional air insufflation in patients undergoing colonoscopy. The investigators test the hypothesis that compared with air insufflation and water immersion, water exchange produces a significantly higher adenoma detection rate in the right colon

detailed_description.textblock: All of the procedures will be recorded and stored as digital files.

primary_outcome.measure: adenoma detection rate in the right colon

secondary_outcome.description: pain or distention on a 0 to 10 VAS scale
incidence of bleeding, perforation and unexpected admission

arm_group.description: Air insufflation will be used throughout whole procedure of colonoscopy
Water will be infused during the insertion phase and removed during withdrawal phase of colonoscopy
Water will be infused and removed during insertion phase of colonoscopy

intervention.description: Insufflation during colonoscopy including insertion phase
Water will infused during insertion phase and removed during withdrawal phase of colonoscopy
Water will infused and removed during insertion phase of colonoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing colonoscopy performed by the participating endoscopists
Exclusion Criteria:
- obstructive lesions of the colon known before colonoscopy
- massive ascites
- past history of partial colectomy
- refusal to provide written informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Buddhist Dalin Tzu Chi General Hospital

facility.name: Sepulveda Ambulatory Care Center, Veterans Affairs Greater

reference.citation: Bressler B, Paszat LF, Vinden C, Li C, He J, Rabeneck L. Colonoscopic miss rates for right-sided colon cancer: a population-based analysis. Gastroenterology. 2004 Aug;127(2):452-6.

Leung FW, Amato A, Ell C, Friedland S, Harker JO, Hsieh YH, Leung JW, Mann SK, Paggi S, Pohl J, Radaelli F, Ramirez FC, Siao-Salera R, Terruzzi V. Water-aided colonoscopy: a systematic review. Gastrointest Endosc. 2012 Sep;76(3):657-66. doi: 10.1016/j.gie.2012.04.467. Review.

Radaelli F, Paggi S, Amato A, Terruzzi V. Warm water infusion versus air insufflation for unsedated colonoscopy: a randomized, controlled trial. Gastrointest Endosc. 2010 Oct;72(4):701-9. doi: 10.1016/j.gie.2010.06.025.
Hsieh YH, Lin HJ, Tseng KC. Limited water infusion decreases pain during minimally sedated colonoscopy. World J Gastroenterol. 2011 May 7;17(17):2236-40. doi: 10.3748/wjg.v17.i17.2236.
